title: Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Early Warning System," Front Side", ca. 1987
medium: Black and red marking pens, brush and watercolor/colored inks (?); white and yellow pastel/crayon (?), graphite on white tracing paper
description: Three panel screen on wheels with left and center panel forming a square painted with  blue and black checks. (Map segments are visible under the black checks.)  A yellow lightning bolt intersects left panel at upper left; a green target is on top of center panel. An orange triangle on red supporting leg intersects square from the right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Screen Design:  "Early Warning System," Front Side", ca. 1987.
ca. 1987. Black and red marking pens, brush and watercolor/colored inks (?); white and yellow pastel/crayon (?), graphite on white tracing paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-99.
